strong.span: Our HOOFPRINTS are paving the way

h4.span: MOT Charter School serves students in grades K-12, on two campuses in Middletown, Delaware. Our team provides an intellectually rigorous academic program in a warm and nurturing environment where children learn and flourish. Valuing the experience of the whole child, MOT Charter strives to model the responsibilities which come from being part of an interdependent, yet diverse community; where open and honest communication helps build compassion, understanding, collaboration, integrity and leadership.

div.span: High School PTO: Monthly meeting @ MOT Charter High School

a.class: ai1ec-sas-action ai1ec-btn ai1ec-btn-primary ai1ec-btn-xs ai1ec-btn-sm ai1ec-sas-action-tickets

div.h3: Meet us to find out what we’ll be planning next and how you can get involved!
div.p: As always, we ask that you join the PTO Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1621856094732510/?ref=bookmarks. The MOT Charter HS PTO Facebook page is a closed group for parents, teachers & students to use for updates on everything the PTO and the school are doing as well as sign up for various volunteer opportunities to satisfy your yearly 10 hour volunteer commitment.

div.span: High School: Sports Boosters Monthly Meeting @ MOT Charter High School

a.class: ai1ec-sas-action ai1ec-btn ai1ec-btn-primary ai1ec-btn-xs ai1ec-btn-sm ai1ec-sas-action-tickets

div.h3: With several hundred student-athletes, the Sports Boosters always has something going on!
Parents are invited to come out and see how you can get involved!

a.class: ai1ec-sas-action ai1ec-btn ai1ec-btn-primary ai1ec-btn-xs ai1ec-btn-sm ai1ec-sas-action-tickets

div.p: Please see the MOT Charter School website for Board Meeting agenda and minutes.

p.span:
Celebrating our 8th Grade Student Athletes! Meet Katelyn.
Katelyn Blevins, Girls Soccer
MOT Charter School, 8th Grade
This is Katelyn’s second season playing left wing for the girls soccer team at MOT Charter School. She also played right mid-field for field hockey at MOT Charter School all three years of middle school.
Give me three words that you feel best describe you.
Outgoing, friendly, athletic
Who would play you in a movie about your life?
Lauren Marano
If you could live anywhere where would it be?
Australia
If you had only one sense (hearing, touch, sight, etc.) which would you want the most?
Sight
Who is your hero and why?
My great grandfather, Vernon Hubbard, is my hero because he went through so much to get where he was and his story is so inspirational.
What is the weirdest nickname you have ever been given during sports and who gave it to you?
“Pickle” from Brianna Wade
What is your favorite memory from middle school sports?
Captains practice for field hockey because we got to plan a whole practice.
What is your favorite memory from your time as a Mustang
In 3rd grade I won a medal and big crystal for a cursive handwriting contest that went to the national level.
@lori_blevins77 @kate_blevi

img.alt:

What is your favorite memory from middle school sports? Captains practice for field hockey because we got to plan a whole practice.
What is your favorite memory from your time as a Mustang In 3rd grade I won a medal and big crystal for a cursive handwriting contest that went to the national level. @lori_blevins77 @kate_blevi

p.span:
Celebrating our Senior Athletes! Meet Trevor.
Trevor Selby, Varsity Baseball
MOT Charter High School
Trevor Selby has played baseball all four years of high school. His primary position has been first base. Trevor has been a member of the Varsity Baseball squad from the first year that MOT Charter High School had a Varsity Sports during his sophomore year. He also played basketball both freshman and sophomore year as well as soccer his freshman year.
Give me three words that you feel best describe you.
Funny, Kind, & Competitive
Who would play you in a movie about your life?
Frank Thomas
If you could live anywhere where would it be?
On the outskirts of Orlando, Florida.
If you had only one sense (hearing, touch, sight, etc.) which would you want the most?
Sight
Who is your hero and why?
My hero is my parents because they show me how I can be the best person I can.
What is the weirdest nickname you have ever been given during sports and who gave it to you?
T Sexy and Nana A. on the soccer team my freshman year.
What is your favorite memory from high school sports?
My favorite memory is having a lot of fun with the baseball team my junior year. I had a lot of senior friends on the team and I had a lot of fun playing with them for the last time.
What is your favorite memory from your time as a Mustang?
There's too many memories for me to name. But the WORST is when my mom started substituting at the school.
What are your future plans?
My future plan is to become a commercial pilot and fly all around the world.

img.alt:
